decision_conditions: The garaging and/or car parking shown on the approved plans shall be provided with a hard-bound, adequately-drained, dust-free surface prior to beneficial occupation of the development to which this permission relates and shall be permanently retained and kept free from obstruction thereafter. It shall not be used for any purposes other than the parking of vehicles for the occupiers of and visitors to the development.Reason: To ensure the provision of adequate off-street parking in the interests of the safety and operation of the highway network, in accordance with policies T4 and T6 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS7 and DM9 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.
The proposal would comply with the criteria of Class O of Part 3 of Schedule 2 to the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).

The development to which this approval relates must be completed within a period of 3 years starting with the prior approval date.Reason: As required by Paragraph O.2(2) of Part 3 of Schedule 2 to the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).

Prior to beneficial occupation of the development to which this permission relates, evidence showing that the development has achieved at least a 19% improvement in CO2 emissions versus Part L of the Building Regulations and internal water usage rates of no greater than 105L per person per day have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.Reason: In the interests of sustainability and energy conservation, in accordance with policies CS1, DM3 and DM4 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Prior to the commencement of any development above ground level, details of waste and recycling facilities to serve the development to which this permission relates shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The refuse and recycling facilities as shown in the approved details shall be provided prior to beneficial occupation of the development and shall be permanently retained thereafter. The developer and/or their successors in title shall take all reasonable steps to ensure that all refuse and recyclable materials associated with the development are either stored within these facilities or internally within the building(s) on the application site, and that no refuse or recycling material is stored or placed for collection on the public highway except on the day of collection.Reason: To ensure proper waste management in the interests of the character and appearance of the area and the living conditions of neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with policy SI17 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS8 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Prior to the commencement of any development above ground level, details of secure cycle parking facilities to serve the development to which this permission relates shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.The cycle parking facilities as shown in the approved details shall be provided prior to beneficial occupation of the development to which this permission relates and shall be permanently retained for that purpose and kept free from obstruction thereafter.Reason: To ensure that appropriate opportunities to promote sustainable transport are taken up, in accordance with policy T5 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS6 and DM8 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Prior to beneficial occupation of the development to which this permission relates, the applicant shall provide a scheme to the Local Planning Authority for its written approval detailing sound transmission reduction measures to be installed between the ground floor A3 use and the first floor flat.  The scheme shall be designed to be 5dB better than that given in Approved Document E (2003 Edition incorporating 2004 and 2010 amendments) of the Building Regulations (Table 0.1a, page 12). Once agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority the approved details shall be installed prior to the development being occupied and retained thereafter.Reason: To ensure satisfactory living conditions for the occupants of the development, in accordance with policy D14 of the London Plan 2021 policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Scale Bar Issues - the scale bars on the Site Location Plan, Block Plan and Site Plans do not measure to the stated scale. Extracts are shown below. You will need to submit the original PDF plans purchased. Please refer to the Validation Local List (pages 10-13) for requirements for each of these plans. (https://www.kingston.gov.uk/downloads/file/2737/validation-local-list)

Site Location plan red line - please amend the red line to include land necessary to carry out the proposed development, i.e. land required for access to the site from a public highway. Note: A Site Location Plan must be at a scale of either 1:1250 or 1:2500 which identifies the site and the surrounding area and shows at least two roads and the north point. The site should be outlined in red and any other land owned by the applicant in blue. It should include land necessary to carry out the proposed development (e.g. land required for access to the site from a public highway, visibility splays, car parking and open areas around buildings).

Please provide Existing and Proposed Elevations at a recognised scale (at 1:50 or 1:100 for example), showing all elevations and indicating all key dimensions. A scale bar is encouraged.We require all elevations. You can label these as "Existing Elevations (no change proposed)"

Please provide Existing and Proposed Floor Plans at a recognised scale (at 1:50 or 1:100 for example), showing the outline of the entire floor plan, not just part and all key dimensions for the proposed works. The plans must also show the direction of North. A scale bar is encouraged.The Existing Floor Plan area would be labelled e.g. as "residential outbuilding", and the Proposed Floor Plan area would be labelled e.g. as "Business space"

Please provide Existing and Proposed Roof Plans at a recognised scale (at 1:50 or 1:100 for example), showing the outline of the entire property not just part and showing dimensions of the proposed work. The plans must show the direction of North. A scale bar is highly encouraged.You can label this as "Existing Roof Plan (no change proposed)"

Validation Checklist Update - Once you have provided any additional documents please update the Validation Checklist document to confirm that they have been provided by stating "Yes" where relevant. Please ensure this is updated, e.g. photographs have been submitted but the Checklist states they have not.
application_type_full: Prior Approval: Change of use - offices to dwellinghouses
description: Conversion of Offices Class B1(a) on first floor to 3no. one-bedroom flats with associated parking facilities
